Position: Software Developer (Javascript)
Reporting To: Director, Enterprise Tools
Location: Chapel Hill, NC; Minneapolis, MN; Boston, MA (Newton Office); New York, NY
Compensation Information: This role could be hired for at the Software Engineer 3 ($105,001-$117,500) or Software Engineer 4 ($117,501-$130,000) level, based on qualifications.
Position Summary:
Upon joining our team, you will contribute to the development of a world-class technology platform that supports our members, customers and team members. You'll get to collaborate with a diverse group of backend and web developers, data scientists, and other internal colleagues to design, implement and govern features that impact our entire organization. We are looking for an eager, engaged software engineer who is excited to use modern cloud technologies to build new features that will make a difference. This is an opportunity for rapid early career learning and growth in software development, cloud infrastructure and healthcare data! We expect you to be excited to learn, collaborate and contribute to solutions in a variety of technologies. Self-motivation, teamwork, and ability to work in a fast-paced agile environment are important.
Key Responsibilities:
Contribute to new user interface features and improvements on our data ingestion process
Collaborate with a team of experienced software engineers, DevOps engineers and data scientists to create and deliver a seamless, tailored experience for our users
Help build and maintain internal administrative applications that support core functioning of our technology platform
Help us achieve operational excellence in software development by participating in and leading code reviews, quality assurance, and production monitoring
Take personal responsibility for keeping all Well systems and data, including sensitive member data, secure and safe, according to Well data and security policies and HIPAA guidelines
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in delivery of software utilizing Node.js, Javascript, React, Go - ideally with a broad area of interest spanning other similar/promising programming languages.
2+ years of software development experience using modern programming languages and cloud providers.
Good understanding of engineering principles, a variety of common tools, patterns, algorithms/libraries and use cases, key trade-offs and systems design.
Coding capabilities, demonstrated ability to resolve complex technical challenges.
Experience with test driven development, and understanding of the importance of testing in developing high quality software.
Willingness to learn new patterns, languages, technologies and methodologies, aligning both with our Engineering culture and continuously evolving technology environment.
Good understanding of microservices patterns with insight into choices and tradeoffs involved.
Experience with modern cloud platforms; AWS, GCP, Azure.
Good understanding of the HTTP stack and REST APIs.
Good understanding of databases and their tradeoffs.
Knowledge of modern content management systems.
Experience in Healthcare contexts is considered a plus but not a necessity.
Good understanding of security principles in software development broadly and as specifically applied to consumer-facing applications.
Degree and background in a related field such as Computer Science, Engineering or a quantitative discipline with strong demonstrated practical experience.
Additional Job Information
Well is on a mission to redefine the healthcare experience. This is an opportunity to re-shape healthcare for America. We are developing solutions to improve the quality and affordability of healthcare. We welcome team members who are passionate about that mission. We embrace diversity and are committed to building an inclusive team.
Well is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. We seek diversity and encourage individuals from underrepresented groups to apply.

Title: Software Developers – All Levels
Job Description:
We are constantly looking to add to our team of software developers; you must bring a passion for your craft and a commitment to excellence. Our projects offer a wide variety of team roles and functions, and exposure to a range of creative development opportunities. Our development staff work closely with our technical subject matter experts in building and supporting applications our customers consider mission critical. Our projects include hosted solutions, mobile applications, omni-channel communications and complex systems integration. We develop some of our own applications and products, and develop solutions using other industry-leading products and technologies.

BENEFITS
Generous compensation and a great benefits package that includes health, dental, vision, life insurance, disability, 401k, and paid time off.
Stability and a comfortable work environment – Established in 1991, we are a privately-held company that is profitable and debt-free. You will enjoy a casual, flexible, team-oriented work environment.
Sell cutting-edge technology – We have developed and continue to enhance a hosted call-center automation Solution as a Service (SaaS) offering that combines their proprietary applications with industry-leading hosted infrastructure from Aspect Communications.
Direct access to meaningful projects – We have always been at the forefront of advanced contact center technology and participate in meaningful projects that help our customers and help society as a whole: After Hurricane Katrina, we, along with partner Siemens Communications, were asked to build and deliver a mobile 911 center and set it up in the devastated region of Plaquemines Parish, Louisiana outside New Orleans in a week to assist with recovery efforts. We are also actively involved in implementing Next Generation 911 solutions for the U.S. Department of Defense and for State, local, and international emergency operations centers.
Flexible Work Hours – We offer flexible work hours and support remote work schedules as needed.

For further information, we invite you to send your resume to jobs@microautomation.com.

Title: Software Developer Entry Level
Job Description:
Ready to kickstart your career in technology?
If so, GenSpark could be an excellent opportunity for you! We have opportunities for entry-level developers with a foundation in programming that are looking to launch their technology career.
As a GenSparker, you don’t just get a job - you also get job-ready training. During your first 6 weeks with GenSpark, we provide paid training in technical and soft skills to build upon your existing technical knowledge. This role will train you to be a Software Developer.
After completing GenSpark’s training, you will work with our clients to design and implement scalable software solutions, gaining hands-on experience with the technologies you just trained on. Responsibilities include working with client teams to develop innovative solutions and solving complex business problems with next-gen technologies. Most GenSpark clients are Fortune 500 employers seeking skilled & diverse talent, so you will gain experience working with one of the world's top employers. GenSpark's emphasis on training and hands-on experience provides the perfect platform to accelerate your career as a Developer. IT’s your future – invest in it!
GenSpark's vision is to accelerate equity in the workplace and in society by lighting up pathways to career success for individuals from all backgrounds. We support individuals from all walks of life, including those from underrepresented minorities in technology.
What we are looking for:
Authorised to work in United States
Strong skills in communication, motivation, and self-discipline
Willing to commit to a role for a minimum of 16 months
Knowledge of multiple programming languages and technologies, specially in Java
Must have basic understanding in Object Oriented Programming.
Bachelor's in Computer Systems or STEM degree required
What we offer:
Rapid career growth, with focused and intensive training
Paid training for 6 weeks, i.e. $250/weekly stipend will be provided
The pay range post cohort and selection will be $45k-$60k/annually
Compensation in line with industry norms
Excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits
Relocation assistance, if required for client assignment
Mentorship and support throughout the full program
Networking opportunities within your industry with peers and industry leaders
GenSpark fills technology talent gaps by bridging underrepresented pools of talent to corporations in need of key skills. The company’s passion for opportunity and diversity translates into a recasting of the tech workforce, with deep investment in both client and candidate success. Candidates are employed and custom-trained to the specifications of client firms, connecting the unconnected to refreshed and fulfilling careers. This Atlanta-based firm serves clients and candidates nationwide. GenSpark is a certified Great Place to Workand a division of Pyramid Consulting, Inc.
For more information, visit www.GenSpark.net

Title: Associate Java Developer
Job Description:
Urban League is looking for a passionate, experienced Software Engineer who thrives in a highly collaborative, team environment. The right candidate will have significant experience mentoring and coaching agile development teams towards achieving the organization's goals. As the Software Developer, you will lead and manage all members of the software development team and focus on developing the people and processes that make Urban League a great place to work.

Responsibilities

As a Software Engineer, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on high performing, high throughput multi-threaded applications and will need very good problem-solving and debugging skills, and come up with strategies to solve them. You will be part of a self-organizing team where architecting, designing and implementation of system enhancements are collectively determined and implemented along with QA engineers:

Architect, design and implement features/enhancements as needed by the business.
Perform analysis and improve performance and throughput of the systems.
Identify bottlenecks, problems, and come up with strategies to resolve them.
Identify and implement solutions for automated monitoring of the systems.
Make improvements in the applications so that it needs lesser manual intervention and facilitates automated monitoring and correcting problems.
Perform system maintenance and application deployments on a regular basis.
Identify bottlenecks and problems in the architecture and suggest strategies to improve.
Experience and Skills

Excellent, demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to work well in a small team environment.
Good aptitude to provide support to business users of the system.
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies.
Benefits
Competitive salary - $125,000-$145,000/year
Comp-time and flexible work hours
Full health, life, disability, and dental insurance
Retirement plan with company contribution
Annual company profit sharing
Personal development/training budget
Open, collaborative work environment
Company provided refreshments

Java developer roles and responsibilities include managing Java/Java EE application development while providing expertise in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing. Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL and ORM technologies (JPA2, Hibernate)

Title: Java Backend Developer
Job Description:
Job Description :
The Enterprise Payments/Treasury Management team is looking for a high-capacity individual that will work under the guidance of our Architect to assist us in creating best in class Enterprise APIs and the necessary Production Infrastructure to successfully provide performance, scale and reliability. These individuals might find themselves assisting in the following activities on a daily basis:
Developing modern RESTful API’s using Java and Spring Boot, full stack developer, DevOps, CICD, Cloud enabled services (Container, both on prem and in the cloud)
Assist with system design / Business Analysis (server layout, availability, disaster recovery planning, production deployments etc.)
Assist with software / Data design (Database Schema, Storage considerations, Data Mapping, Data Storage Efficiency, NOSQL Data Considerations, RDMS to NOSQL considerations, Flat file to NOSQL considerations and design related matters, API design including call signature, schema, business logic, data access, resilience, logging, supportability etc.)
Assist with software delivery (Hands on – typically, but also in an advisory or architectural role in order to Create server architecture, create table layouts, Create highly available data resources, Create highly recoverable data resources, Configure highly performant data sources)
Assist with a transition to Kafka – specifically with analyzing proper use cases, detailed Kafka environment setup considerations, enrichment, and transformations.
Assist with transitioning from a Physical / Virtual Machine environment to one based on cloud run environments and containers.
We are looking for innovative, hands-on engineers who are excited about the newest technologies and are committed to embracing the future of software engineering. Responsibilities include implementing API layers and integrating that work into our continuous delivery, continuous integration pipeline.
Responsibilities include:
Collaborate with other engineers and architects to create a common API layer between a variety of different data sources and applications via an agile product model working in 2-week sprints.
Develop software in an agile environment leveraging DevOps for environment setup, automated builds, continuous deployment, continuous integration, and automated testing.
Play a key role implementing enterprise services and APIs under the guidance of the architectural team and engineering leadership.
Deliver rapid, scalable, and quality solutions that meet the business needs. Develop and implement unit test code and automated test scripts as a routine part of development activities.
Work closely with other engineers, vendor partners and business owners to ensure that the finished solution meets the needs of the business and our customers.
Follow industry standard agile software design methodologies. Embrace new technologies and methods Introduce.
Maintain and evolve existing integration assets and systems.

Title: Junior Software Developer (ASP.NET C# Application Development)
Job Description:
Consider joining our growing team at Accessory Power. We manufacture several brands of consumer electronic tech accessories: GOgroove® | ENHANCE® | ReVIVE® | USA Gear® along with a handful of other lines and various accessory products. We’re growing! Become a vital member of our team and our growth.Basic Description:
The Junior Software Developer, using their skills in advanced problem solving and technical programming, works as a key part of our growing department and in cooperation with the Art Department, Operations, and eCommerce teams to aid in the creation and ongoing development of in-house software and web applications which improve our growing and evolving business operations. A successful candidate will be a critical thinker, a professionally kind collaborator, and proven problem solver who works well in teams and under pressure with often competing deadlines. This is an opportunity for a junior programmer to apply their existing .NET C#, SQL/Database, and web development skills in an Agile, small and entrepenurial team environment.
Job Responsibilities:
Analyze business problems and help to design technical software solutions to those problems.
Help to build custom software applications and web applications which may interact with order systems, customer service systems, inventory systems, and/or shipping systems.
Help to identify and resolve bugs occurring in software and web applications.
Analyze current software solutions and build enhancements to improve those solutions.
Requirements
Basic Requirements:
Education: BA/BS in Computer Science or related field of study.
A minimum of 2 years of job-related software development experience.
Verifiable English language and writing skills.
A deep desire to resolve complex problems with creative and organized technical solutions.
Proficiency with cross-browser HTML and CSS programming, JavaScript, JQuery, MVC, WCF and WebForms.
Understanding of Microsoft Windows services, web services, SOAP, or XML file exchange.
Deep understanding of Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design.
Proficiency working within and manipulating MS SQL, MySQL, or Firebird databases.
Must be able to understand and help generate written documentation for software solutions.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with software collaboration, project management, or other digital organizational tools.
GIT experience in code collaboration.
Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers.
Extremely organized, have an obsessive attention to detail, and a thirst to multi task.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.
Benefits
Pay range: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour.
This is a full-time position that reports daily to our Westlake Village, CA headquarters.
Our staff works hard and plays hard too. We sponsor many fun activities such as on-site massage treatments, evening softball and basketball leagues, company outings and events, quarterly department lunches, and even on-site yoga classes.
Accessory Power full time employees are entitled to a comprehensive benefits package including: Vacation, Paid Holidays, PPO and HMO Medical Plans, Free Dental Insurance & Vision Coverage, employee discounts, and a 401(k) Retirement Plan + employer match.
If you are hired, we will require you to prove that you have received the COVID-19 vaccine or have a valid religious or medical reason not to be vaccinated.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Software Developer
Job Description:
Stark Tech is searching for a full time Software Developer to join our growing team. If you are a highly motivated individual with great attention to detail, and a drive for continuous process improvements to help expedite high-quality product deployment we want to talk to you!
How are you successful in this role?
The ideal candidate must have the ability to work as a cross-functional team member who can support multiple teams by applying technology and problem solving skills. Be able to perform hands on customized development and testing of software solutions for our customers, primarily based on Microsoft technologies. Work as part of a team to develop software and database architecture and designs for new solutions. Have the strong ability in gathering requirements and accurately document. Actively participate in quality assurance, deploy releases and updates, and support applicable software systems.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field from an accredited university
Minimum of 3 years experience in software application development required
Minimum of 3 years experience in JavaScript or TypeScript, HTML, CSS required
Experience with Java, Angular and Go are required
What we would love to see?
Experience with developing and supporting applications infrastructure
Experience with SQL and Relational Databases
Experience with Azure or AWS
Experience with source control management systems such as Git
Experience with software design patterns OOP
Experience with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerBi
Experience with Agile and Scrum project management techniques
Experience with building control systems and communication protocols such as BACnet and Modbus
Who are we?
Stark Intelligence is a leading provider of comprehensive intelligent building management solutions for facilities in multiple industries. Stark Intelligence transforms operations and building performance with intelligent solutions and expert services through best-in-class technology and industry-leading expertise. Stark's Intelligence platform harnesses billions of points of data to execute energy and operational strategies designed to solve business challenges.

Title: Back End Software Engineering Apprentice
Job Description:
HP is a leading global provider of IT products, technologies, solutions, and services to consumers and businesses. We leverage our strong financial position to extend our leadership in traditional markets and invest in exciting new technologies such as 3D printing, immersive computing, hyper-mobility, the Internet of all things, and smart machines. Be part of an organization that manages the Supply Chain IT functions in HP. We design and implement solutions primarily on the SAP platform to support the internal HP business worldwide.
This is a hybrid role - you will be required to go into the office.
A typical day
What you’ll learn: Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) framework. Proficiency in the following tools and technologies: Java, Unix, WebLogic, SAP, ABAP.
The hands-on work you will experience: As a Software Engineering Apprentice at HP, you’ll work as part of a larger team of experienced developers in an interactive, collaborative environment.
You’ll work on backend systems for large-scale applications for users on web and mobile devices
You'll have opportunities to solve real issues by analyzing system integrations and debugging code
You’ll learn the fundamentals of development, design, testing, agile principles, and continuous delivery.
Best of all, you will be a contributing member of your team, putting forward ideas, taking on responsibilities, and making choices about how you get the job done
Education Required
Either a High School Diploma, GED, or Associate Degree
Knowledge and Skills
Teamwork
Communication
Learning
Prior interest in coding; some exposure to web development through personal projects, academics, or professional experience
Able to work independently and take initiative, as well as work collaboratively and contribute to an agile team environment
Understanding of supply chain principles and concepts
Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
An interest in Teamwork
Great Communication skills
Learning mentality
Problem Solving skills

About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.
So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.
From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

Title: Software Engineer
Job Description:
At Microsoft, our core mission is empowering every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Microsoft Entra sits within our Security, Compliance, Identity and Management Division and is at the heart of the day-to-day technology experience for billions of humans globally, playing a critical part in enabling everyone to achieve more. Our suite of products powers everything from Windows to Office, Azure to Xbox. Microsoft Entra is a dynamic and inclusive team which cares deeply about our customer experience and works to solve extraordinarily complex problems at extreme scale. If that sounds fun, we would love to meet you!

Responsibilities

Microsoft's Entra Platform is seeking a Software Engineer to join our team and help tackle some of our most complex problems. Our Platform team, of which you would be a part, is charged to increase availability of mission-critical services, building better software to serve over 1B humans globally. Are you passionate about distributed systems, and know how to build and run them at extreme scale? Are you curious, a learner, someone who wants to grow in the craft of software engineering?

You will work on some lynchpin services in Identity, e.g. CI/CD, traffic management, runtime platform or livesite management. These services process millions of requests per second, powering hundreds of billions of authentications per day, and with challenging availability targets (>99.99%). You will be part of the team shipping critical software quickly and safely. This is a hands-on role, you will need to be a team player, equally comfortable designing the better mousetrap, and rolling up your sleeves to ship the new mousetrap from whiteboard into production.
Qualifications
Required/Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 2+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python
OR equivalent experience.
Additional/Preferred Qualifications
Experience with designing and delivering elegant solutions to meet complex design and architectural challenges in a cloud services environment.
Practical experience operating high-scale services in production environments. You’ve got experience and opinions on what great observability looks like, what safe deployments look like and whether to push code on Fridays.
Comfortable presenting to large audiences and customers.
Prior experience with performance analysis and optimization of web services and software.
Prior experience building services which run on Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud or Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.
Prior experience working in the Identity and/or Security domains.

Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Software Engineering IC3 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $94,300 - $182,600 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $120,900 - $198,600 per year.

Title: C++ C# Embedded Software Developer (Remote)
Job Description:
Who are we?
We are Diesel Laptops, one of South Carolina’s fastest-growing companies! Founded in 2015, Diesel Laptops has grown from 1 employee to 200+ employees and nearly $70,000,000 in annualized sales in just 7 short years.
We’re currently an industry leader in providing diagnostic solutions to fleets and repair shops. Whether it’s on-highway (like tractor-trailers), off-highway (like cranes and similar heavy equipment), or marine (like powerboats), if it has a diesel engine, we help fix it by providing the highest quality diagnostic kits, repair information, parts information, and related training and support services as a one-stop shop efficiency solution!
We've already disrupted an industry by providing fleet shop total solutions that no one else offers. Now it's time to revolutionize the industry by strengthening our brand through our revolutionary products and services you will help support.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
We currently have an immediate opening for a C++/C# Software Developer with Mobile Development experience to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion and desire to work with a team of developers to create and upgrade software applications for light, medium, and heavy-duty vehicles. They will have a strong work ethic, a can-do-anything attitude, and a drive to continually learn and improve their craft.
The ideal candidate will have a passion and desire to work with a team of developers to create and upgrade software applications for light, medium, and heavy-duty vehicles. They will have a strong work ethic, a can-do-anything attitude, and a drive to continually learn and improve their craft.
Responsibilities:
· Develop and maintain C#/Xamarin application code for Android and iOS platforms.
Create and maintain Azure CI/CD Pipelines
Assist with deployment of apps via the Google Playstore and Apple Appstore
Develop and maintain embedded real-time applications for light-, medium-, and heavy-duty vehicles and equipment in C/C++ on various microprocessor platforms.
Use various communication/messaging protocols such as TCP/IP, CAN bus, and other vehicle protocols such as J1939, ISO15765, J1708/J1587, J1850VPW, J1850PWM, ISO9141, and ISO14230.
Work with common SAE and TMC industry standards such as TMC RP1210, SAE J2534, ISO14229, SAE J1979/OBDII, and SAE J2012.
Replicate existing functionality in third-party software like bi-directional commands and recreate within Diesel Laptops software.
Work closely with Product Managers and Stakeholders to understand needs and help the team design innovative and user-friendly applications.
Participate in team-oriented exercises such as code reviews, training, and sharing existing knowledge.
Write highly readable, reliable, and reusable code by following Diesel
Other duties as assigned
Required Experience:
3+ years of experience in mobile app development using xamarin
1+ years of experience as an embedded software engineer using C/C++.
2+ years of experience in object-oriented design and multithreading.
1+ years of working remotely.
Knowledge Required:
Knowledge of Azure Devops is a plus
Knowledge of AWS is a plus
Knowledge of the ESP32 microprocessor family and FreeRTOS is a plus.
Knowledge of working with communication/messaging protocols like CAN and TCP/IP is a plus.
Familiarity with C#, Xamarin, React Native and development of Android or iOS apps is preferred.
Familiarity with Google Playstore and Apple Appstore deployments is a plus
Familiarity with source code control, such as GitHub, is preferred.
Familiarity with some User-Interface (UI) design and deployment is a plus.
Physical Requirements:
Can Type at computer for 8 hours a day.
Sitting for long periods of time; standing occasionally; walking; bending; squatting; kneeling; pushing/pulling; reaching; twisting; frequent lifting of less than 10 lbs.,
occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs.;
typing; data entry; grasping; transferring items between hands and/or to another person or receptacle; use of office equipment to include computers.
Travel: 0-10%.
Location:Remote
Attire: Casual, Business Casual on tour days.
Other: Must be eligible to work in the U.S.A. without sponsorship. May be subject to criminal background checks.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Software Developer - Remote
Job Description:
Job Description
Job Title: Software Developer – FULLY REMOTE
Reports To: Manager of Software Development
What do we do at Karmak? We create dealer management systems (DMS) software for the heavy-duty trucking industry. Walk into any auto or truck dealership or parts/service shop, and they’ll access a DMS to check their inventory for a new sale or schedule your vehicle for an oil change. At Karmak, our team of industry experts design, develop, train, and support DMS systems that provide visibility, control, and cost savings to our customers.
We are innovative problem solvers and we’re always looking for bright, curious minds to join our team. Karmak has been on the highway of this industry for 40 years and we serve more than 1,500 locations across North America. We are a 100% employee owned, so each employee’s success is a company investment.
Vroom…
Karmak is in the fast lane to building a successful team that likes to work with innovative technology. Our customers are in the commercial transportation industry and streamlined operations have never been more important. Karmak has been on the highway of this industry for 40 years and we serve more than 1,500 locations across North America. We are a 100% employee owned, so each employee’s success is a company investment.
Daily Job Functions – What’s in your GPS?
Work on a collaborative mid-size team of Software Developers delivering consistent, high quality software
Create accurate, unambiguous designs for new computer software and/or updates to existing software
Guide estimation of software development tasks
Create efficient, high quality, readable code, unit tests, and documentation
Assist with code reviews to help team member develop skills
Diagnose and design system/software and performance issues
Mentor developers on your team
Knowledge & Skills – What’s Under the Hood?
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent, relevant experience
2-4 years of experience building web-based C# .NET applications using Microsoft Visual Studio
WinForms experience is a plus
Experience in an Agile/Scrum environment a plus
Proven ability to be accountable on roadmap deliverables within quality process and standardsExperience designing, developing, and deploying applications on the Microsoft Azure platform a plus
Experience building applications for any of the following areas a plus: Point of Sale, Accounting, Inventory management, Sales management, Trucking or automotive service management, Customer Relationship Management
Driving Privileges
Within the first 30 days, you will be able to demonstrate a strong understanding of our products and tech stack. By 60 days, you will be directly involved in projects. We are looking for someone that enjoys working on a collaborative team oriented environment.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Software Developer
Job Description:
Elutions is a global Enterprise AI & Automation company, empowering some of the world’s largest corporations to drive continuous efficiency, cost and quality improvements. We believe Artificial Intelligence is one of the world’s most important green technologies that has the possibility to change the way large corporations consume resources and impact the planet.

At Elutions we value diverse perspectives and backgrounds, embracing the ability to challenge each other and learn from each other’s strengths. We work very collaboratively, are never afraid to ask the tough questions and above all else value honesty and transparency. It’s safe to say that there is never a dull moment when you are part of the Elutions team.

As the top leader in our industry, world-wide, we are constantly on the lookout for go-getters. Currently, we are experiencing significant growth and looking for creative team players who aren't afraid to work hard, but have fun at the same time. Those who join our team aren't just bright, they are willing to develop and hone their skills every day, all while making a significant difference in the world.

To join the team, a successful candidate will be asked to perform necessary hardware and software evaluations to ensure above-average product performance, developing efficient and easily understandable control and display software, and will have the ability to understand industry product application concepts and implement proper software solutions to exceed our client’s expectations.

General Functions:
Carry out assigned divisional duties under the close supervision of senior and management level employees
Respond to internal and external communications in a timely manner
Enter data into electronic databases and file electronic and paper records
Generate reports
Actively seek feedback from peers, senior, and management team members
Escalate concerns and recommendations to senior or management team members
Assist senior and management team members as needed
Work during assigned office hours and attend required meetings
Manage time appropriately to meet project and task completion timelines
Expand capabilities through on-the-job training from senior or management level employees
Conduct yourself in a manner consistent with the firm’s Guiding Principles

Basic Qualifications:
Software development skills, preferably in C#, Visual Basic, .Net, SQL, and Python
Familiarity with SVN concepts and software
Familiarity with SQL Server
Familiarity with JavaScript, CSS, and UI frameworks (React and/or Angular) and other front-end development technologies
A solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals, data structures, algorithms, object-oriented design and systems architecture
Problem solving and troubleshooting skills

Software Engineer Divisional Functions:
Aid the overall effort toward sales and client satisfaction by analyzing and correcting internal software and customer problems
Assist and provide support on sales inquiries with technical data and customer presentations
Create software development processes for the creation and validation of prototype logic and program code for implementation across various operating systems
Research new technologies and trends for future designs that enhance the value of developed solutions to customers
Work with other engineering disciplines to evaluation interface between hardware and software and analyze with operational and performance requirements of overall systems
Modify and test prototype software using working models or theoretical models based on computer simulation
Be available and committed to traveling within the US or abroad to provide on-site support
Perform other duties and projects as directed

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Demonstrated ability in software engineering best practices and processes
Working knowledge of rational database-centered applications
Efficient in verbal software demonstrations
Other relevant experience includes: ASP.NET, Graphic Design, Statistics. Working knowledge of MVC, CSS, JSON, HTML5
Experience with Microsoft applications
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for live software demonstration purposes
Knowledge of major protocols
Familiarity with topology design, network hardware and device configuration
A solid understanding of performance and efficiency issues
Experience with distributed computing and enterprise-wide systems
A strong customer orientation
Conduct evaluations of hardware and software required to ensure optimal performance and product lifetime

Motivational Fit:
Must be willing to learn new skills, be a self-started team player
Ability to organize and prioritize responsibilities effectively in order to meet deadlines
Ability to recognize problems, gather data, draw valid conclusions, and effectively present information to managers, peers, and customers
Ability to work effectively with a wide variety of people

Educational Requirements:
Minimum of Bachelor’s degree in a software centric engineering program OR other degree program plus 1-3 years applicable work experience

What Elutions Brings to the Table:
Flexible, family-friendly schedules
Ability to work alongside the best and the brightest
A generous time-off policy
Partial employer-paid benefits for you and your family
A fun, creative, and pet-friendly work environment
Great location – downtown Delafield, with bars, restaurants and shopping all within walking distance
Opportunity to travel the world and see your hard work come to life

Other Duties:

The above duties are not intended to be all-inclusive or permanent. The requirements of the position may change based on business need or to aide in the employee's growth and development. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
